thread.title: Biden says religious freedom is key to fighting extremism

title: Biden says religious freedom is key to fighting extremism
text: Close Image 1 of 6 Vice President Joe Biden speaks at the annual dinner of The Order of St. Andrew the Apostle, Archons of the Ecumenical Patriarchate, after he was presented the Athenagoras Human Rights Award in New York, Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015. Vice President Joe Biden speaks at the annual dinner of The Order of St. Andrew the Apostle, Archons of the Ecumenical Patriarchate, after he was presented the Athenagoras Human Rights Award in New York, ... more Photo: Craig Ruttle, AP Image 2 of 6 Vice President Joe Biden speaks at the annual dinner of The Order of St. Andrew the Apostle, Archons of the Ecumenical Patriarchate, after he was presented the Athenagoras Human Rights Award in New York, Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015. Vice President Joe Biden speaks at the annual dinner of The Order of St. Andrew the Apostle, Archons of the Ecumenical Patriarchate, after he was presented the Athenagoras Human Rights Award in New York, ... more Photo: Craig Ruttle, AP Image 5 of 6 Vice President Joe Biden stands up before speaking at the annual dinner of The Order of St. Andrew the Apostle, Archons of the Ecumenical Patriarchate, as he was presented the Athenagoras Human Rights Award in New York, Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015. Vice President Joe Biden stands up before speaking at the annual dinner of The Order of St. Andrew the Apostle, Archons of the Ecumenical Patriarchate, as he was presented the Athenagoras Human Rights Award ... more Photo: Craig Ruttle, AP Image 6 of 6 Vice President Joe Biden motions to a gathering to take their seats while he is applauded as he was introduced at the annual dinner of The Order of St. Andrew the Apostle, Archons of the Ecumenical Patriarchate, before he was presented the Athenagoras Human Rights Award in New York, Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015. At left is Greek Ambassador to the U.S. Christos Panagopoulos, and at right is Demetrios, Archbishop of America, Greek Orthodox Church. Vice President Joe Biden motions to a gathering to take their seats while he is applauded as he was introduced at the annual dinner of The Order of St. Andrew the Apostle, Archons of the Ecumenical ... more Photo: Craig Ruttle, AP Biden says religious freedom is key to fighting extremism 1 / 6 Back to Gallery NEW YORK (AP) â€” Vice President Joe Biden says protecting religious liberty is a moral imperative that defends society against violent extremist. Biden received the Athenagoras Human Rights Award at a ceremony Saturday night in New York. It's the highest award bestowed by the Greek Orthodox Church . Biden says terrorist groups like al-Qaida and the Islamic State pervert Islam to justify horrific acts. He says America will be strong as long as it's a beacon for human rights. The vice president says religious values are entirely consistent with civic values in the U.S. He's crediting his Catholic faith for giving him "refuge and reassurance." Biden didn't make any reference to his deliberations about running for president. One of his top advisers says he'll make a decision in the near future.
